TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit Formatter extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter
Public MustInherit Class Formatter Implements IFormatter

Docs.summary: Provides base functionality for the common language runtime serialization formatters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter> is the `abstract` base class for all runtime serialization formatters, and provides some helper methods for implementing the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter> interface. The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter> also manages queuing objects for serialization and generating IDs on a per-object basis.

block.para:
When you inherit from , you must override the following members:

protected: Formatter();

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates a <xref:System.Collections.Queue> for objects to serialize and a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ObjectIDGenerator> to generate IDs for them.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder Binder { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder Binder
Public MustOverride Property Binder As SerializationBinder

public: abstract property System::Runtime::Serialization::SerializationBinder ^ Binder { System::Runtime::Serialization::SerializationBinder ^ get(); void set(System::Runtime::Serialization::SerializationBinder ^ value); };
member this.Binder : System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder with get, set

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the used with the current formatter.
Docs.value: The used with the current formatter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder> performs lookups for types from the type names passed during deserialization. If no <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder> is set, a default is used.

block.para: You must implement this property in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext Context { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext Context
Public MustOverride Property Context As StreamingContext

public: abstract property System::Runtime::Serialization::StreamingContext Context { System::Runtime::Serialization::StreamingContext get(); void set(System::Runtime::Serialization::StreamingContext value); };
member this.Context : System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext with get, set

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the used for the current serialization.
Docs.value: The used for the current serialization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> is an indication of either the source of the bits being deserialized or the destination of the bits being serialized. It has no impact on default serialization, but is passed as an argument to <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializationSurrogate>.

block.para: You must implement this property in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract object Deserialize (System.IO.Stream serializationStream);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Deserialize(class System.IO.Stream serializationStream) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function Deserialize (serializationStream As Stream) As Object
public: abstract System::Object ^ Deserialize(System::IO::Stream ^ serializationStream);
abstract member Deserialize : System.IO.Stream -> obj

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, deserializes the stream attached to the formatter when it was created, creating a graph of objects identical to the graph originally serialized into that stream.
Docs.returns: The top object of the deserialized graph of objects.

block.para: You must implement this method in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual object GetNext (out long objID);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetNext([out] int64& objID) cil managed
Protected Overridable Function GetNext (ByRef objID As Long) As Object
protected: virtual System::Object ^ GetNext([Runtime::InteropServices::Out] long % objID);
abstract member GetNext : -> obj override this.GetNext : -> obj

Docs.param: The ID assigned to the current object during serialization.
Docs.summary: Returns the next object to serialize, from the formatter's internal work queue.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Objects are returned in a first in first out order based on how they were passed to <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.Schedule%2A>. The ID of the object is put into the `objID` parameter and the object is returned from the function.

Docs.exception: The next object retrieved from the work queue did not have an assigned ID.

Docs.summary: Contains the used with the current formatter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ObjectIDGenerator> maintains a list of the objects that have been identified and the IDs that they were given.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.Collections.Queue m_objectQueue;
.field family class System.Collections.Queue m_objectQueue
Protected m_objectQueue As Queue
protected: System::Collections::Queue ^ m_objectQueue;
val mutable m_objectQueue : System.Collections.Queue

Docs.summary: Contains a of the objects left to serialize.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Objects scheduled for serialization with the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.Schedule%2A> method are pushed on the queue.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual long Schedule (object obj);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Schedule(object obj) cil managed
Protected Overridable Function Schedule (obj As Object) As Long
protected: virtual long Schedule(System::Object ^ obj);
abstract member Schedule : obj -> int64 override this.Schedule : obj -> int64

Docs.param: The object to schedule for serialization.
Docs.summary: Schedules an object for later serialization.
Docs.returns: The object ID assigned to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.Schedule%2A> obtains an ID for the object and puts it on the queue for later serialization if this is a new object ID. The schedule is a work queue of objects to serialize, and is held inside the formatter. If the object is already on the work queue, it will not be added a second time, but an exception will not be thrown either.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Serialize (System.IO.Stream serializationStream, object graph);

abstract member Serialize : System.IO.Stream * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The stream to which the objects are serialized.
The object at the root of the graph to serialize.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, serializes the graph of objects with the specified root to the stream already attached to the formatter.

block.para: You must implement this method in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector SurrogateSelector { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector SurrogateSelector
Public MustOverride Property SurrogateSelector As ISurrogateSelector

public: abstract property System::Runtime::Serialization::ISurrogateSelector ^ SurrogateSelector { System::Runtime::Serialization::ISurrogateSelector ^ get(); void set(System::Runtime::Serialization::ISurrogateSelector ^ value); };
member this.SurrogateSelector : System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector with get, set

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the used with the current formatter.
Docs.value: The used with the current formatter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SurrogateSelector> to look up implementations of <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializationSurrogate> that control the serialization of a particular type.
If an object type has a matching surrogate, then serialization and deserialization are handed off to the surrogate even if the type implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.

block.para: You must implement this property in a derived class.

Docs.param: The name of the member to serialize.
The object to write to the stream attached to the formatter.
Docs.summary: Inspects the type of data received, and calls the appropriate method to perform the write to the stream already attached to the formatter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To use this method properly, all the `Write` methods (<xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteArray%2A> method, <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteBoolean%2A> method, <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatter.WriteByte%2A> method, and so on) should have the appropriate functionality.
